The code reads an integer input from the user and stores it in the variable w.
It then initializes an empty string variable base3.
It enters a while loop that continues until the value of w is 0.
Inside the loop, it calculates the remainder of w divided by 3 and stores it in the variable r.
It then checks the value of r and performs the following actions:
If r is 0, it appends a 0 to the beginning of the string base3 and divides w by 3.
If r is 1, it appends a + to the beginning of the string base3 and divides w by 3.
If r is 2, it appends a - to the beginning of the string base3, divides w by 3, and increments w by 1.
After the loop finishes, it prints the value of base3 as the output.
